intro: Cronquistianthus marrubiifolius, commonly known as the Marrubiifolius Cronquistianthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
